reviews.review_msg: Eva is a super nice lady, always caring, anything happens, go talk to her, she can always give you the best solution. Take ling111 before this, it will help. Note taking course. Has two group work.

Eva is the sweetest prof I've met at SFU. She deeply cares about the education of her students and makes an effort to memorize everybodies names. Her examples of the topics really helps to understand the material. Two group projects that were a bit difficult but it was nothing crazy. Her exams are definitly challaning.

Didn't love the online format of this course, partway through it started to get messy. In person office hours with Eva was wonderful however, super sweet and clear explanations. Would definitely take more courses with her in person

She is probably the best teacher I have ever met. First off, she is a very caring a loving person, which makes me more inspired to be working hard in this class. She is willing to explain things over and over, to make sure we understand her course materials. Yes, her exams are hard, but it's not impossible to get a good grade if you just study.

Eva is a really nice prof imo - the textbook was allowed for exams and she's lays out her expectations with todo lists. Theres weekly assignments and 2 group projects which aren't awful. Make sure you stay on top of your readings because the material is accumulative + its easy to fall behind. Overall an ok course if u stay on top of yourself

Eva cares for her students and she is really a sweetheart! She has a PhD and she knows a lot about linguistics. I like Eva so much and I decide to take her other linguistics courses. However, she is not the best professor I've ever met at least in my first semester. She could have taught more clearly though. Linguistics is hard anyway.
Pay attention during the class and do the homework from textbook. Get ready to memorize, but it's not that heavy. Overall is good.
